publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1785 John Young: War Memorial—That the Parliament acknowledges the bravery and sacrifice of the 35,000 British and Commonwealth personnel who died during the North African Campaign of World War II and supports the establishment of a war memorial in Libya.
S1M-1785 War Memorial (lodged on 23 March 2001) Andrew Wilson*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*

S1M-1785 War Memorial (lodged on 23 March 2001) Donald Gorrie*, Mr Adam Ingram*, David Mundell*, Bill Aitken*, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*, Ben Wallace*, Colin Campbell*, Dennis Canavan*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Mr Murray Tosh*, Phil Gallie*
S1M-1785 War Memorial (lodged on 23 March 2001) Mr Gil Paterson*, Maureen Macmillan*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Robert Brown*

S1M-1785 John Young: War Memorial—That the Parliament acknowledges the bravery and sacrifice of the 35,000 British and Commonwealth personnel who died during the North African Campaign of World War II and supports the establishment of a war memorial in Libya. Supported by: Andrew Wilson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Donald Gorrie, Mr Adam Ingram, David Mundell, Bill Aitken, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Ben Wallace, Colin Campbell, Dennis Canavan, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Murray Tosh, Phil Gallie, Mr Gil Paterson, Maureen Macmillan, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Robert Brown, John Scott*
S1M-1785 War Memorial (lodged on 23 March 2001) Alex Fergusson*, Kay Ullrich*
S1M-1785 War Memorial (lodged on 23 March 2001) Mrs Margaret Ewing*
S1M-1785 War Memorial (lodged on 23 March 2001) Dr Elaine Murray*
S1M-1785 War Memorial (lodged on 23 March 2001) Michael Russell*, Mr David Davidson*, Mr Brian Monteith*

S1M-1785 John Young: War Memorial—That the Parliament acknowledges the bravery and sacrifice of the 35,000 British and Commonwealth personnel who died during the North African Campaign of World War II and supports the establishment of a war memorial in Libya. Supported by: Andrew Wilson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Donald Gorrie, Mr Adam Ingram, David Mundell, Bill Aitken, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Ben Wallace, Colin Campbell, Dennis Canavan, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Murray Tosh, Phil Gallie, Mr Gil Paterson, Maureen Macmillan, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Robert Brown, John Scott, Alex Fergusson, Kay Ullrich, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Dr Elaine Murray, Michael Russell, Mr David Davidson, Mr Brian Monteith

S1M-1785 War Memorial (lodged on 23 March 2001) Fergus Ewing*
